properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: enable_l7
properties.description: • enable_l7 - (Required) Specifies whether to enable L7 defense.

properties.name: traffic_pos_id
properties.description: • traffic_pos_id - (Required) The position ID of traffic. The value ranges from 1 to 9.

properties.name: http_request_pos_id
properties.description: • http_request_pos_id - (Required) The position ID of number of HTTP requests. The value ranges from 1 to 15.

properties.name: cleaning_access_pos_id
properties.description: • cleaning_access_pos_id - (Required)The position ID of access limit during cleaning. The value ranges from 1 to 8.

properties.name: app_type_id
properties.description: • app_type_id - (Required) The application type ID.

properties.name: floating_ip_id
properties.description: • floating_ip_id - (Required) The ID corresponding to the Elastic IP Address (EIP) of a user.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: scaling_configuration_name
properties.description: • scaling_configuration_name - (Required) The name of the AS configuration. The name can contain letters, digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-), and cannot exceed 64 characters.

properties.name: instance_config
properties.description: • instance_config - (Required) The information about instance configurations. The instance_config dictionary data structure is documented below.
The instance_config block supports:

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Optional) When using the existing instance specifications as the template to create AS configurations, specify this argument. In this case, flavor, image, and disk arguments do not take effect. If the instance_id argument is not specified, flavor, image, and disk arguments are mandatory.

properties.name: flavor
properties.description: • flavor - (Optional) The flavor ID.

properties.name: image
properties.description: • image - (Optional) The image ID.

properties.name: disk
properties.description: • disk - (Optional) The disk group information. System disks are mandatory and data disks are optional. The dick structure is described below.

properties.name: key_name
properties.description: • key_name - (Required) The name of the SSH key pair used to log in to the instance.

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: • user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance. The file content must be encoded with Base64.

properties.name: personality
properties.description: • personality - (Optional) Customize the personality of an instance by defining one or more files and their contents. The personality structure is described below.

properties.name: public_ip
properties.description: • public_ip - (Optional) The elastic IP address of the instance. The public_ip structure is described below.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from within the instance.
The disk block supports:

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The disk size. The unit is GB. The system disk size ranges from 40 to 32768, and the data disk size ranges from 10 to 32768.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Required) The disk type, which must be the same as the disk type available in the system. The options include SATA (common I/O disk type) and SSD (ultra-high I/O disk type).

properties.name: disk_type
properties.description: • disk_type - (Required) Whether the disk is a system disk or a data disk. Option DATA indicates a data disk. option SYS indicates a system disk.

properties.name: kms_id
properties.description: • kms_id - (Optional) The Encryption KMS ID of the data disk.
The personality block supports:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.

properties.name: contents
properties.description: • contents - (Required) The content of the injected file, which must be encoded with base64.
The public_ip block supports:

properties.name: eip
properties.description: (Required) The configuration parameter for creating an elastic IP address that will be automatically assigned to the instance. The eip structure is described below.
The eip block supports:

properties.name: ip_type
properties.description: • ip_type - (Required) The IP address type. The system only supports 5_bgp (indicates dynamic BGP).

properties.name: bandwidth
properties.description: • bandwidth - (Required) The bandwidth information. The structure is described below.
The bandwidth block supports:

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The bandwidth (Mbit/s). The value range is 1 to 300.

properties.name: share_type
properties.description: • share_type - (Required) The bandwidth sharing type. The system only supports PER (indicates exclusive bandwidth).

properties.name: charging_mode
properties.description: • charging_mode - (Required) The bandwidth charging mode. The system only supports traffic.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: scaling_group_name
properties.description: • scaling_group_name - (Required) The name of the scaling group. The name can contain letters, digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-),and cannot exceed 64 characters.

properties.name: scaling_configuration_id
properties.description: • scaling_configuration_id - (Optional) The configuration ID which defines configurations of instances in the AS group.

properties.name: desire_instance_number
properties.description: • desire_instance_number - (Optional) The expected number of instances. The default value is the minimum number of instances. The value ranges from the minimum number of instances to the maximum number of instances.

properties.name: min_instance_number
properties.description: • min_instance_number - (Optional) The minimum number of instances. The default value is 0.

properties.name: max_instance_number
properties.description: • max_instance_number - (Optional) The maximum number of instances. The default value is 0.

properties.name: cool_down_time
properties.description: • cool_down_time - (Optional) The cooling duration (in seconds). The value ranges from 0 to 86400, and is 900 by default.

properties.name: lb_listener_id
properties.description: • lb_listener_id - (Optional) The ELB listener IDs. The system supports up to three ELB listeners, the IDs of which are separated using a comma (,).

properties.name: lbaas_listeners
properties.description: • lbaas_listeners - (Optional) An array of one or more enhanced load balancer. The system supports the binding of up to three load balancers. The field is alternative to lb_listener_id. The lbaas_listeners object structure is documented below.

properties.name: available_zones
properties.description: • available_zones - (Optional) The availability zones in which to create the instances in the autoscaling group.

properties.name: networks
properties.description: • networks - (Required) An array of one or more network IDs. The system supports up to five networks. The networks object structure is documented below.

properties.name: security_groups
properties.description: • security_groups - (Required) An array of one or more security group IDs to associate with the group. The security_groups object structure is documented below.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) The VPC ID. Changing this creates a new group.

properties.name: health_periodic_audit_method
properties.description: • health_periodic_audit_method - (Optional) The health check method for instances in the AS group. The health check methods include ELB_AUDIT and NOVA_AUDIT. If load balancing is configured, the default value of this parameter is ELB_AUDIT. Otherwise, the default value is NOVA_AUDIT.

properties.name: health_periodic_audit_time
properties.description: • health_periodic_audit_time - (Optional) The health check period for instances. The period has four options: 5 minutes (default), 15 minutes, 60 minutes, and 180 minutes.

properties.name: instance_terminate_policy
properties.description: • instance_terminate_policy - (Optional) The instance removal policy. The policy has four options: OLD_CONFIG_OLD_INSTANCE (default), OLD_CONFIG_NEW_INSTANCE, OLD_INSTANCE, and NEW_INSTANCE.

properties.name: notifications
properties.description: • notifications - (Optional) The notification mode. The system only supports EMAIL mode which refers to notification by email.

properties.name: delete_publicip
properties.description: • delete_publicip - (Optional) Whether to delete the elastic IP address bound to the instances of AS group when deleting the instances. The options are true and false.

properties.name: delete_instances
properties.description: • delete_instances - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group when deleting the AS group. The options are yes and no.
The networks block supports:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The network UUID.
The security_groups block supports:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The UUID of the security group.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: scaling_policy_name
properties.description: • scaling_policy_name - (Required) The name of the AS policy. The name can contain letters, digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-),and cannot exceed 64 characters.

properties.name: scaling_group_id
properties.description: • scaling_group_id - (Required) The AS group ID. Changing this creates a new AS policy.

properties.name: scaling_policy_type
properties.description: • scaling_policy_type - (Required) The AS policy type. The values can be ALARM, SCHEDULED, and RECURRENCE.

properties.name: alarm_id
properties.description: • alarm_id - (Optional) The alarm rule ID. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to ALARM.

properties.name: scheduled_policy
properties.description: • scheduled_policy - (Optional) The periodic or scheduled AS policy. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to SCHEDULED or RECURRENCE. The scheduled_policy structure is documented below.

properties.name: scaling_policy_action
properties.description: • scaling_policy_action - (Optional) The action of the AS policy. The scaling_policy_action structure is documented below.

properties.name: cool_down_time
properties.description: • cool_down_time - (Optional) The cooling duration (in seconds), and is 900 by default.
The scheduled_policy block supports:

properties.name: launch_time
properties.description: • launch_time - (Required) The time when the scaling action is triggered. If scaling_policy_type is set to SCHEDULED, the time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ. If scaling_policy_type is set to RECURRENCE, the time format is hh:mm.

properties.name: recurrence_type
properties.description: • recurrence_type - (Optional) The periodic triggering type. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to RECURRENCE. The options include Daily, Weekly, and Monthly.

properties.name: recurrence_value
properties.description: • recurrence_value - (Optional) The frequency at which scaling actions are triggered.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: • start_time - (Optional) The start time of the scaling action triggered periodically. The time format complies with UTC. The current time is used by default. The time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ.

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: • end_time - (Optional) The end time of the scaling action triggered periodically. The time format complies with UTC. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to RECURRENCE. The time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ.
The scaling_policy_action block supports:

properties.name: operation
properties.description: • operation - (Optional) The operation to be performed. The options include ADD (default), REMOVE, and SET.

properties.name: instance_number
properties.description: • instance_number - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone for the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: consistency_group_id
properties.description: • consistency_group_id - (Optional) The consistency group to place the volume in.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the volume. Changing this updates the volume's description.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional) The image ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to associate with the volume. Changing this updates the existing volume metadata. The EVS encryption capability with KMS key can be set with the following parameters:

properties.name: __system__encrypted
properties.description:
The default value is set to '0', which means
the volume is not encrypted, the value '1' indicates volume is encrypted.

properties.name: __system__cmkid
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the kms key.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) Tags key/value pairs to associate with the volume. Changing this updates the existing volume tags.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the volume. Changing this updates the volume's name.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) The snapshot ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: source_replica
properties.description: • source_replica - (Optional) The volume ID to replicate with.

properties.name: source_vol_id
properties.description: • source_vol_id - (Optional) The volume ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Optional) The type of volume to create. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: device_type
properties.description: • device_type - (Optional) The device type of volume to create. Valid options are VBD and SCSI. Defaults to VBD. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: cascade
properties.description: • cascade - (Optional, Default:false) Specifies to delete all snapshots associated with the EVS disk.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Required) The availability zone for the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Required) The type of volume to create. Currently, the value can be SSD, SAS, SATA, co-p1, or uh-l1. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the volume. Changing this updates the volume's name.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Optional) The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). This parameter is mandatory when you create an empty EVS disk or use an image or a snapshot to create an EVS disk. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the volume. Changing this updates the volume's description.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional) The image ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: backup_id
properties.description: • backup_id - (Optional) The backup ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) The snapshot ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) Tags key/value pairs to associate with the volume. Changing this updates the existing volume tags.

properties.name: multiattach
properties.description: • multiattach - (Optional, Default:false) Specifies the shared EVS disk information. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: cascade
properties.description: • cascade - (Optional, Default:false) Specifies to delete all snapshots associated with the EVS disk.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Cluster name. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Cluster tag, key/value pair format. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: annotations
properties.description: • annotations - (Optional) Cluster annotation, key/value pair format. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: flavor_id - (Required) Cluster specifications. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: cce.s1.small
properties.description: small-scale single cluster (up to 50 nodes).

properties.name: cce.s1.medium
properties.description: medium-scale single cluster (up to 200 nodes).

properties.name: cce.s1.large
properties.description: large-scale single cluster (up to 1000 nodes).

properties.name: cce.s2.small
properties.description: small-scale HA cluster (up to 50 nodes).

properties.name: cce.s2.medium
properties.description: medium-scale HA cluster (up to 200 nodes).

properties.name: cce.s2.large
properties.description: large-scale HA cluster (up to 1000 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t1.small
properties.description: small-scale single physical machine cluster (up to 10 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t1.medium
properties.description: medium-scale single physical machine cluster (up to 100 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t1.large
properties.description: large-scale single physical machine cluster (up to 500 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t2.small
properties.description: small-scale HA physical machine cluster (up to 10 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t2.medium
properties.description: medium-scale HA physical machine cluster (up to 100 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t2.large
properties.description: large-scale HA physical machine cluster (up to 500 nodes).

properties.name: cluster_version
properties.description: • cluster_version - (Optional) For the cluster version, possible values are v1.9.2-r2 or v1.11.3-r1. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource. OTC-API

properties.name: cluster_type
properties.description: • cluster_type - (Required) Cluster Type, possible values are VirtualMachine and BareMetal. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Cluster description.

properties.name: billing_mode
properties.description: • billing_mode - (Optional) Charging mode of the cluster, which is 0 (on demand). Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: extend_param
properties.description: • extend_param - (Optional) Extended parameter. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) The ID of the VPC used to create the node. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of the subnet used to create the node. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: highway_subnet_id
properties.description: • highway_subnet_id - (Optional) The ID of the high speed network used to create bare metal nodes. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: container_network_type - (Required) Container network type.

properties.name: overlay_l2
properties.description: An overlay_l2 network built for containers by using Open vSwitch(OVS)

properties.name: underlay_ipvlan
properties.description: An underlay_ipvlan network built for bare metal servers by using ipvlan.

properties.name: vpc-router
properties.description: An vpc-router network built for containers by using ipvlan and custom VPC routes.

properties.name: container_network_cidr
properties.description: • container_network_cidr - (Optional) Container network segment. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: authentication_mode
properties.description: • authentication_mode - (Optional) Authentication mode of the cluster, possible values are x509 and rbac. Defaults to x509. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: multi_az
properties.description: • multi_az - (Optional) Enable multiple AZs for the cluster, only when using HA flavors. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: eip
properties.description: • eip - (Optional) EIP address of the cluster. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cluster_id
properties.description: • cluster_id - (Required) ID of the cluster. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: billing_mode
properties.description: • billing_mode - (Optional) Node's billing mode: The value is 0 (on demand). Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Node Name.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Node tag, key/value pair format. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: annotations
properties.description: • annotations - (Optional) Node annotation, key/value pair format. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: flavor_id
properties.description: • flavor_id - (Required) Specifies the flavor id. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Required) specify the name of the available partition (AZ). Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: key_pair
properties.description: • key_pair - (Required) Key pair name when logging in to select the key pair mode. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: eip_ids
properties.description: • eip_ids - (Optional) List of existing elastic IP IDs. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
Note: If the eip_ids parameter is configured, you do not need to configure the eip_count and bandwidth parameters: iptype, charge_mode, bandwidth_size and share_type.

properties.name: eip_count
properties.description: • eip_count - (Optional) Number of elastic IPs to be dynamically created. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: iptype
properties.description: • iptype - (Required) Elastic IP type.

properties.name: bandwidth_charge_mode
properties.description: • bandwidth_charge_mode - (Optional) Bandwidth billing type. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: sharetype
properties.description: • sharetype - (Required) Bandwidth sharing type. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: bandwidth_size
properties.description: • bandwidth_size - (Required) Bandwidth size. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: extend_param_charging_mode
properties.description: • extend_param_charging_mode - (Optional) Node charging mode, 0 is on-demand charging. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: ecs_performance_type
properties.description: • ecs_performance_type - (Optional) Classification of cloud server specifications. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: order_id
properties.description: • order_id - (Optional) Order ID, mandatory when the node payment type is the automatic payment package period type. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: product_id
properties.description: • product_id - (Optional) The Product ID. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: max_pods
properties.description: • max_pods - (Optional) The maximum number of instances a node is allowed to create. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: public_key
properties.description: • public_key - (Optional) The Public key. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.
root_volume - (Required) It corresponds to the system disk related configuration. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) Disk size in GB.

properties.name: volumetype
properties.description: • volumetype - (Required) Disk type.

properties.name: extend_param
properties.description: • extend_param - (Optional) Disk expansion parameters.
data_volumes - (Required) Represents the data disk to be created. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) Disk size in GB.

properties.name: volumetype
properties.description: • volumetype - (Required) Disk type.

properties.name: extend_param
properties.description: • extend_param - (Optional) Disk expansion parameters.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: alarm_name
properties.description: • alarm_name - (Required) Specifies the name of an alarm rule. The value can be a string of 1 to 128 characters that can consist of numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

properties.name: alarm_description
properties.description: • alarm_description - (Optional) The value can be a string of 0 to 256 characters.

properties.name: metric
properties.description: • metric - (Required) Specifies the alarm metrics. The structure is described below.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: • condition - (Required) Specifies the alarm triggering condition. The structure is described below.

properties.name: alarm_actions
properties.description: • alarm_actions - (Optional) Specifies the actions list triggered by an alarm. The structure is described below.

properties.name: insufficientdata_actions
properties.description: • insufficientdata_actions - (Optional) Specifies the actions list triggered by data insufficiency. The structure is described below.

properties.name: ok_actions
properties.description: • ok_actions - (Optional) Specifies the actions list triggered by the clearing of an alarm. The structure is described below.

properties.name: alarm_enabled
properties.description: • alarm_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the alarm. The default value is true.

properties.name: alarm_action_enabled
properties.description: • alarm_action_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the action to be triggered by an alarm. The default value is true. Note: If alarm_action_enabled is set to true, at least one of the following parameters alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions cannot be empty. If alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions coexist, their corresponding notification_list must be of the same value.
The metric block supports:

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: • namespace - (Required) Specifies the namespace in service.item format. service.item can be a string of 3 to 32 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or underscores (_).

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: • metric_name - (Required) Specifies the metric name. The value can be a string of 1 to 64 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or underscores (_).

properties.name: dimensions
properties.description: • dimensions - (Required) Specifies the list of metric dimensions. Currently, the maximum length of the dimesion list that are supported is 3. The structure is described below.
The dimensions block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the dimension name. The value can be a string of 1 to 32 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Specifies the dimension value. The value can be a string of 1 to 64 characters that must start with a letter or a number and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
The condition block supports:

properties.name: period
properties.description: • period - (Required) Specifies the alarm checking period in seconds. The value can be 1, 300, 1200, 3600, 14400, and 86400. Note: If period is set to 1, the raw metric data is used to determine whether to generate an alarm.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: • filter - (Required) Specifies the data rollup methods. The value can be max, min, average, sum, and vaiance.

properties.name: comparison_operator
properties.description: • comparison_operator - (Required) Specifies the comparison condition of alarm thresholds. The value can be >, =, <, >=, or <=.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Specifies the alarm threshold. The value ranges from 0 to Number of 1.7976931348623157e+308.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: • unit - (Optional) Specifies the data unit.

properties.name: count
properties.description: • count - (Required) Specifies the number of consecutive occurrence times. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
the alarm_actions block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the value can be notification or autoscaling. notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user. autoscaling: indicates that a scaling action will be triggered.

properties.name: notification_list
properties.description: • notification_list - (Required) specifies the topic urn list of the target notification objects. the maximum length is 5. the topic urn list can be obtained from simple message notification (smn) and in the following format: urn: smn:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|-){1,32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]){32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|-|_){1,256}. if type is set to notification, the value of notification_list cannot be empty. if type is set to autoscaling, the value of notification_list must be [] and the value of namespace must be sys.as. Note: to enable the as alarm rules take effect, you must bind scaling policies. for details, see the auto scaling api reference.
the insufficientdata_actions block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the value is notification. notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.

properties.name: notification_list
properties.description: • notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
the ok_actions block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the value is notification. notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.

properties.name: notification_list
properties.description: • notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the listener. The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) Specifies the VPC ID. Changing this creates a new elb loadbalancer.

properties.name: bandwidth
properties.description: • bandwidth - (Optional) Specifies the bandwidth (Mbit/s). This parameter is mandatory when type is set to External, and it is invalid when type is set to Internal. The value ranges from 1 to 300.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Specifies the load balancer type. The value can be Internal or External. Changing this creates a new elb loadbalancer.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Required) Specifies the status of the load balancer. Value range: false: indicates that the load balancer is stopped or frozen; true: indicates that the load balancer is running properly. Only tenants are allowed to enter these two values.

properties.name: vip_subnet_id
properties.description: • vip_subnet_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the private network to be added. This parameter is mandatory when type is set to Internal, and it is invalid when type is set to External. Changing this creates a new elb loadbalancer.

properties.name: az
properties.description: • az - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the availability zone (AZ). This parameter is mandatory when type is set to Internal, and it is invalid when type is set to External. Changing this creates a new elb loadbalancer.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Optional) Specifies the security group ID. The value is a string of 1 to 200 characters that consists of uppercase and lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens (-). This parameter is mandatory only when type is set to Internal. Changing this creates a new elb loadbalancer.

properties.name: vip_address
properties.description: • vip_address - (Optional) Specifies the IP address provided by ELB. When type is set to External, the value of this parameter is the elastic IP address. When type is set to Internal, the value of this parameter is the private network IP address. You can select an existing elastic IP address and create a public network load balancer. When this parameter is configured, parameter bandwidth is invalid. Changing this creates a new elb loadbalancer.

properties.name: tenantid
properties.description: • tenantid - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory only when type is set to Internal.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the listener. The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: • loadbalancer_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the load balancer to which the listener belongs. Changing this creates a new elb listener.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) Specifies the listening protocol used for layer 4 or 7. The value can be HTTP, TCP, HTTPS, or UDP. Changing this creates a new elb listener.

properties.name: protocol_port
properties.description: • protocol_port - (Required) Specifies the listening port. The value ranges from 1 to 65535.

properties.name: backend_protocol
properties.description: • backend_protocol - (Required) Specifies the backend protocol. If the value of protocol is UDP, the value of this parameter can only be UDP. The value can be HTTP, TCP, or UDP. Changing this creates a new elb listener.

properties.name: backend_port
properties.description: • backend_port - (Required) Specifies the backend port. The value ranges from 1 to 65535.

properties.name: lb_algorithm
properties.description: • lb_algorithm - (Required) Specifies the load balancing algorithm for the listener. The value can be roundrobin, leastconn, or source.

properties.name: session_sticky
properties.description: • session_sticky - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable sticky session. The value can be true or false. The Sticky session is enabled when the value is true, and is disabled when the value is false. If the value of protocol is HTTP, HTTPS, or TCP, and the value of lb_algorithm is not roundrobin, the value of this parameter can only be false. Changing this creates a new elb listener.

properties.name: session_sticky_type
properties.description: • session_sticky_type - (Optional) Specifies the cookie processing method. The value is insert. insert indicates that the cookie is inserted by the load balancer. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, and session_sticky to true. The default value is insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol is set to TCP or UDP, which means the parameter is empty. Changing this creates a new elb listener.

properties.name: cookie_timeout
properties.description: • cookie_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the cookie timeout period (minutes). This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, session_sticky to true, and session_sticky_type to insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol is set to TCP or UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440. Changing this creates a new elb listener.

properties.name: tcp_timeout
properties.description: • tcp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the TCP timeout period (minutes). This parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP. The value ranges from 1 to 5.

properties.name: tcp_draining
properties.description: • tcp_draining - (Optional) Specifies whether to maintain the TCP connection to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP. The value can be true or false.

properties.name: tcp_draining_timeout
properties.description: • tcp_draining_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the timeout duration (minutes) for the TCP connection to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP, and tcp_draining to true. The value ranges from 0 to 60.

properties.name: certificate_id
properties.description: • certificate_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the SSL certificate used for security authentication when HTTPS is used to make API calls. This parameter is mandatory if the value of protocol is HTTPS. The value can be obtained by viewing the details of the SSL certificate. Changing this creates a new elb listener.

properties.name: udp_timeout
properties.description: • udp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the UDP timeout duration (minutes). This parameter is valid when protocol is set to UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440.

properties.name: ssl_protocols
properties.description: • ssl_protocols - (Optional) Specifies the SSL protocol standard supported by a tracker, which is used for enabling specified encryption protocols. This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The value is TLSv1.2 or TLSv1.2 TLSv1.1 TLSv1. The default value is TLSv1.2. Changing this creates a new elb listener.

properties.name: ssl_ciphers
properties.description: • ssl_ciphers - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol. This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2 TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: listener_id
properties.description: • listener_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the listener to which the health check task belongs. Changing this creates a new elb health.

properties.name: healthcheck_protocol
properties.description: • healthcheck_protocol - (Optional) Specifies the protocol used for the health check. The value can be HTTP or TCP (case-insensitive).

properties.name: healthcheck_uri
properties.description: • healthcheck_uri - (Optional) Specifies the URI for health check. This parameter is valid when healthcheck_ protocol is HTTP. The value is a string of 1 to 80 characters that must start with a slash (/) and can only contain letters, digits, and special characters, such as -/.%?#&.

properties.name: healthcheck_connect_port
properties.description: • healthcheck_connect_port - (Optional) Specifies the port used for the health check. The value ranges from 1 to 65535.

properties.name: healthy_threshold
properties.description: • healthy_threshold - (Optional) Specifies the threshold at which the health check result is success, that is, the number of consecutive successful health checks when the health check result of the backend server changes from fail to success. The value ranges from 1 to 10.

properties.name: unhealthy_threshold
properties.description: • unhealthy_threshold - (Optional) Specifies the threshold at which the health check result is fail, that is, the number of consecutive failed health checks when the health check result of the backend server changes from success to fail. The value ranges from 1 to 10.

properties.name: healthcheck_timeout
properties.description: • healthcheck_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the maximum timeout duration (s) for the health check. The value ranges from 1 to 50.

properties.name: healthcheck_interval
properties.description: • healthcheck_interval - (Optional) Specifies the maximum interval (s) for health check. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: listener_id
properties.description: • listener_id - (Required) Specifies the listener ID. Changing this creates a new elb backend.

properties.name: server_id
properties.description: • server_id - (Required) Specifies the backend member ID. Changing this creates a new elb backend.

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Required) Specifies the private IP address of the backend member. Changing this creates a new elb backend.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Cluster name. It contains 4 to 32 characters. Only letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (_) are allowed. The value must start with a letter. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: node_config
properties.description: • node_config - (Required) Instance object. Structure is documented below. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The node_config block supports:

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Optional) Availability zone (AZ). Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: flavor
properties.description: • flavor - (Required) Instance flavor name. Value range of flavor css.medium.8: 40 GB to 640 GB Value range of flavor css.large.8: 40 GB to 1280 GB Value range of flavor css.xlarge.8: 40 GB to 2560 GB Value range of flavor css.2xlarge.8: 80 GB to 5120 GB Value range of flavor css.4xlarge.8: 160 GB to 10240 GB Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: network_info
properties.description: • network_info - (Required) Network information. Structure is documented below. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: volume
properties.description: • volume - (Required) Information about the volume. Structure is documented below. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The network_info block supports:

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) Network ID. All instances in a cluster must have the same networks and security groups. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Required) Security group ID. All instances in a cluster must have the same subnets and security groups. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) VPC ID, which is used for configuring cluster network. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The volume block supports:

properties.name: encryption_key
properties.description: • encryption_key - (Optional) Key ID. The Default Master Keys cannot be used to create grants. Specifically, you cannot use Default Master Keys whose aliases end with /default in KMS to create clusters. After a cluster is created, do not delete the key used by the cluster. Otherwise, the cluster will become unavailable. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) Volume size, which must be a multiple of 4 and 10. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Required) COMMON: Common I/O. The SATA disk is used. HIGH: High I/O. The SAS disk is used. ULTRAHIGH: Ultra-high I/O. The solid-state drive (SSD) is used. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
<hr/>

properties.name: enable_https
properties.description: • enable_https - (Optional) Whether communication encryption is performed on the cluster. Available values include true and false. By default, communication encryption is enabled. Value true indicates that communication encryption is performed on the cluster. Value false indicates that communication encryption is not performed on the cluster. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: expect_node_num
properties.description: • expect_node_num - (Optional) Number of cluster instances. The value range is 1 to 32.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: pool
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating IP. Default value is admin_external_net. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: floating_ip
properties.description: • floating_ip - (Required) The floating IP to associate.

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Required) The instance to associte the floating IP with.

properties.name: fixed_ip
properties.description: • fixed_ip - (Optional) The specific IP address to direct traffic to.
NOTE: The tags attribute has been deprecated and might be removed in future releases, please use tag instead.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the resource.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional; Required if image_name is empty and not booting from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The image ID of the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: image_name
properties.description: • image_name - (Optional; Required if image_id is empty and not booting from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The name of the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: flavor_id
properties.description: • flavor_id - (Optional; Required if flavor_name is empty) The flavor ID of the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.

properties.name: flavor_name
properties.description: • flavor_name - (Optional; Required if flavor_id is empty) The name of the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: • user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: security_groups
properties.description: • security_groups - (Optional) An array of one or more security group names to associate with the server. Changing this results in adding/removing security groups from the existing server. Note: When attaching the instance to networks using Ports, place the security groups on the Port and not the instance.

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone in which to create the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: network
properties.description: • network - (Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the instance. Required when there are multiple networks defined for the tenant. The network object structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from within the instance. Changing this updates the existing server metadata.

properties.name: config_drive
properties.description: • config_drive - (Optional) Whether to use the config_drive feature to configure the instance. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: admin_pass
properties.description: • admin_pass - (Optional) The administrative password to assign to the server. Changing this changes the root password on the existing server.

properties.name: key_pair
properties.description: • key_pair - (Optional) The name of a key pair to put on the server. The key pair must already be created and associated with the tenant's account. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: block_device
properties.description: • block_device - (Optional) Configuration of block devices. The block_device structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server. You can specify multiple block devices which will create an instance with multiple disks. This configuration is very flexible, so please see the following reference for more information.

properties.name: scheduler_hints
properties.description: • scheduler_hints - (Optional) Provide the Nova scheduler with hints on how the instance should be launched. The available hints are described below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - DEPRECATED (Optional) The tags of the image. It must be a list of strings.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: • tag - (Optional) Tags key/value pairs to associate with the instance.

properties.name: stop_before_destroy
properties.description: • stop_before_destroy - (Optional) Whether to try stop instance gracefully before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly. If instance doesn't stop within timeout, it will be destroyed anyway.

properties.name: force_delete
properties.description: • force_delete - (Optional) Whether to force the OpenTelekomCloud instance to be forcefully deleted. This is useful for environments that have reclaim / soft deletion enabled.

properties.name: auto_recovery
properties.description: • auto_recovery - (Optional) Configures or deletes automatic recovery of an instance
The network block supports:

properties.name: uuid
properties.description: • uuid - (Required unless port or name is provided) The network UUID to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required unless uuid or port is provided) The human-readable name of the network. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required unless uuid or name is provided) The port UUID of a network to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: fixed_ip_v4
properties.description: • fixed_ip_v4 - (Optional) Specifies a fixed IPv4 address to be used on this network. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: fixed_ip_v6
properties.description: • fixed_ip_v6 - (Optional) Specifies a fixed IPv6 address to be used on this network. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: access_network
properties.description: • access_network - (Optional) Specifies if this network should be used for provisioning access. Accepts true or false. Defaults to false.
The block_device block supports:

properties.name: uuid
properties.description: • uuid - (Required unless source_type is set to "blank" ) The UUID of the image, volume, or snapshot. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: source_type
properties.description: • source_type - (Required) The source type of the device. Must be one of "blank", "image", "volume", or "snapshot". Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: volume_size
properties.description: • volume_size - The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Required in the following combinations: source=image and destination=volume, and source=blank and destination=volume. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Optional) Currently, the value can be SSD (ultra-I/O disk type), SAS (high I/O disk type), or SATA (common I/O disk type) OTC-API

properties.name: boot_index
properties.description: • boot_index - (Optional) The boot index of the volume. It defaults to 0. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: destination_type
properties.description: • destination_type - (Optional) The type that gets created. Currently only support "volume". Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: delete_on_termination
properties.description: • delete_on_termination - (Optional) Delete the volume / block device upon termination of the instance. Defaults to false. Changing this creates a new server.
The scheduler_hints block supports:

properties.name: group
properties.description: • group - (Optional) A UUID of a Server Group. The instance will be placed into that group.

properties.name: different_host
properties.description: • different_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will be scheduled on a different host than all other instances.

properties.name: same_host
properties.description: • same_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will be scheduled on the same host of those specified.

properties.name: query
properties.description: • query - (Optional) A conditional query that a compute node must pass in order to host an instance.

properties.name: target_cell
properties.description: • target_cell - (Optional) The name of a cell to host the instance.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: build_near_host_ip - (Optional) An IP Address in CIDR form. The instance will be placed on a compute node that is in the same subnet.

properties.name: tenancy
properties.description: (Optional) The tenancy specifies whether the ECS is to be created on a Dedicated Host (DeH) or in a shared pool.

properties.name: deh_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of DeH. This parameter takes effect only when the value of tenancy is dedicated.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the keypair. Changing this creates a new keypair.

properties.name: public_key
properties.description: • public_key - (Required) A pregenerated OpenSSH-formatted public key. Changing this creates a new keypair.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the security group. Changing this updates the name of an existing security group.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A description for the security group. Changing this updates the description of an existing security group.

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule - (Optional) A rule describing how the security group operates. The rule object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the security group rules. As shown in the example above, multiple rule blocks may be used.
The rule block supports:

properties.name: from_port
properties.description: • from_port - (Required) An integer representing the lower bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: to_port
properties.description: • to_port - (Required) An integer representing the upper bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: ip_protocol
properties.description: • ip_protocol - (Required) The protocol type that will be allowed. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: • cidr - (Optional) Required if from_group_id or self is empty. The IP range that will be the source of network traffic to the security group. Use 0.0.0.0/0 to allow all IP addresses. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with from_group_id or self.

properties.name: from_group_id
properties.description: • from_group_id - (Optional) Required if cidr or self is empty. The ID of a group from which to forward traffic to the parent group. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with cidr or self.

properties.name: self
properties.description: • self - (Optional) Required if cidr and from_group_id is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with cidr or from_group_id.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the server group. Changing this creates a new server group.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Required) The set of policies for the server group. Only two two policies are available right now, and both are mutually exclusive. See the Policies section for more information. Changing this creates a new server group.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

properties.name: policies-1
properties.description: » Policies

properties.name: affinity
properties.description: • affinity - All instances/servers launched in this group will be hosted on the same compute node.

properties.name: anti-affinity
properties.description: • anti-affinity - All instances/servers launched in this group will be hosted on different compute nodes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Required) The ID of the Instance to attach the Volume to.

properties.name: volume_id
properties.description: • volume_id - (Required) The ID of the Volume to attach to an Instance.

properties.name: device
properties.description: • device - (Optional) The device of the volume attachment (ex: /dev/vdc). NOTE: Being able to specify a device is dependent upon the hypervisor in use. There is a chance that the device specified in Terraform will not be the same device the hypervisor chose. If this happens, Terraform will wish to update the device upon subsequent applying which will cause the volume to be detached and reattached indefinitely. Please use with caution.

properties.name: tags

properties.name: name
