properties.description: • security_groups - (Optional) An array of one or more security group names to associate with the server. Changing this results in adding/removing security groups from the existing server.

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Required) The availability zone in which to create the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: auto_recovery
properties.description: • auto_recovery - (Optional) Whether configure automatic recovery of an instance.

properties.name: delete_disks_on_termination
properties.description: • delete_disks_on_termination - (Optional) Delete the data disks upon termination of the instance. Defaults to false. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) Tags key/value pairs to associate with the instance.
The nics block supports:

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) The network UUID to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) Specifies a fixed IPv4 address to be used on this network. Changing this creates a new server.
The data_disks block supports:

properties.name: list description
properties.description: type - (Required) The data disk type of the server. For HANA, HL1, and HL2 ECSs use co-p1 and uh-l1 disks. Changing this creates a new server. Available options are:

properties.name: SATA
properties.description: : common I/O disk type.

properties.name: SAS
properties.description: : high I/O disk type.

properties.name: SSD
properties.description: : ultra-high I/O disk type.

properties.name: co-p1
properties.description: : high I/O(performance-optimized) disk type.

properties.name: uh-l1
properties.description: : ultra-high I/O(latency-optimized) disk type.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The size of the data disk in GB. The value range is 10 to 32768. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) Specifies the snapshot ID or ID of the original data disk contained in the full-ECS image. Changing this creates a new server.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: backup_name
properties.description: • backup_name - (Optional) Name for the backup. The value consists of 1 to 255 characters and can contain only letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). Changing backup_name creates a new backup.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Backup description. The value consists of 0 to 255 characters and must not contain a greater-than sign (>) or less-than sign (<). Changing description creates a new backup.

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: • resource_id - (Required) ID of the target to which the backup is restored. Changing this creates a new backup.

properties.name: resource_type
properties.description: • resource_type - (Optional) Type of the target to which the backup is restored. The default value is OS::Nova::Server for an ECS. Changing this creates a new backup.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: tags - (Optional) block supports the following arguments:

properties.name: key
properties.description: (Required) Tag key. It cannot be an empty string.Changing key creates a new backup.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) Tag value. It can be an empty string.Changing value creates a new backup.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of backup policy. The value consists of 1 to 255 characters and can contain only letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Backup policy description. The value consists of 0 to 255 characters and must not contain a greater-than sign (>) or less-than sign (<).

properties.name: provider_id
properties.description: • provider_id - (Required) Specifies backup provider ID. Default value is fc4d5750-22e7-4798-8a46-f48f62c4c1da

properties.name: common
properties.description: • common - (Optional) General backup policy parameters, which are blank by default.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: scheduled_operation block supports the following arguments:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies Scheduling period name.The value consists of 1 to 255 characters and can contain only letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies Scheduling period description.The value consists of 0 to 255 characters and must not contain a greater-than sign (>) or less-than sign (<).

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether the scheduling period is enabled. Default value is true

properties.name: max_backups
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies maximum number of backups that can be automatically created for a backup object.

properties.name: retention_duration_days
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies duration of retaining a backup, in days.

properties.name: permanent
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether backups are permanently retained.

properties.name: trigger_pattern
properties.description: (Required) Specifies Scheduling policy of the scheduler.

properties.name: operation_type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies Operation type, which can be backup.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: resource block supports the following arguments:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the ID of the object to be backed up.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Entity object type of the backup object. If the type is VMs, the value is OS::Nova::Server.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies backup object name.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: tags block supports the following arguments:

properties.name: key
properties.description: (Required) Tag key. It cannot be an empty string.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) Tag value. It can be an empty string.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: bucket_name
properties.description: • bucket_name - (Required) The OBS bucket name for a tracker.

properties.name: file_prefix_name
properties.description: • file_prefix_name - (Optional) The prefix of a log that needs to be stored in an OBS bucket.

properties.name: is_support_smn
properties.description: • is_support_smn - (Required) Specifies whether SMN is supported. When the value is false, topic_id and operations can be left empty.

properties.name: topic_id
properties.description: • topic_id - (Required)The theme of the SMN service, Is obtained from SMN and in the format of urn:smn:([a-z]|[A-Z]|[0-9]|-){1,32}:([a-z]|[A-Z]|[0-9]){32}:([a-z]|[A-Z]|[0-9]|-|_){1,256}.

properties.name: operations
properties.description: • operations - (Required) Trigger conditions for sending a notification.

properties.name: is_send_all_key_operation
properties.description: • is_send_all_key_operation - (Required) When the value is false, operations cannot be left empty.

properties.name: need_notify_user_list
properties.description: • need_notify_user_list - (Optional) The users using the login function. When these users log in, notifications will be sent.

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - (Optional) The status of a tracker. The value should be enabled when creating a tracker, and when updating the value can be enabled or disabled.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the DB instance name. The DB instance name of the same type is unique in the same tenant. The changes of the instance name will be suppressed in HA scenario.

properties.name: datastore
properties.description: • datastore - (Required) Specifies database information. The structure is described below.

properties.name: flavorref
properties.description: • flavorref - (Required) Specifies the specification ID (flavors.id in the response message in Obtaining All DB Instance Specifications). If you want to enable ha for the rds instance, a flavor with ha speccode is required.

properties.name: volume
properties.description: • volume - (Required) Specifies the volume information. The structure is described below.

properties.name: availabilityzone
properties.description: • availabilityzone - (Required) Specifies the ID of the AZ.

properties.name: vpc
properties.description: • vpc - (Required) Specifies the VPC ID. For details about how to obtain this parameter value, see section "Virtual Private Cloud" in the Virtual Private Cloud API Reference.

properties.name: nics
properties.description: • nics - (Required) Specifies the nics information. For details about how to obtain this parameter value, see section "Subnet" in the Virtual Private Cloud API Reference. The structure is described below.

properties.name: securitygroup
properties.description: • securitygroup - (Required) Specifies the security group which the RDS DB instance belongs to. The structure is described below.

properties.name: dbport
properties.description: • dbport - (Optional) Specifies the database port number.

properties.name: backupstrategy
properties.description: • backupstrategy - (Optional) Specifies the advanced backup policy. The structure is described below.

properties.name: dbrtpd
properties.description: • dbrtpd - (Required) Specifies the password for user root of the database.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: • tag - (Optional) Tags key/value pairs to associate with the instance.

properties.name: ha
properties.description: • ha - (Optional) Specifies the parameters configured on HA and is used when creating HA DB instances. The structure is described below. NOTICE: RDS for Microsoft SQL Server does not support creating HA DB instances and this parameter is not involved.
The datastore block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Specifies the DB engine. Currently, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and Microsoft SQL Server are supported. The value is MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQLServer.

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Required) Specifies the DB instance version.
• Available value for attributes
The volume block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Specifies the volume type. Valid value: It must be COMMON (SATA) or ULTRAHIGH (SSD) and is case-sensitive.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) Specifies the volume size. Its value must be a multiple of 10 and the value range is 100 GB to 2000 GB.
The nics block supports:

properties.name: subnetId
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the subnet ID obtained from the VPC.
The securitygroup block supports:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the ID obtained from the securitygroup.
The backupstrategy block supports:

properties.name: starttime
properties.description: • starttime - (Optional) Indicates the backup start time that has been set. The backup task will be triggered within one hour after the backup start time. Valid value: The value cannot be empty. It must use the hh:mm:ss format and must be valid. The current time is the UTC time.

properties.name: keepdays
properties.description: • keepdays - (Optional) Specifies the number of days to retain the generated backup files. Its value range is 0 to 35. If this parameter is not specified or set to 0, the automated backup policy is disabled.
The ha block supports:

properties.name: enable
properties.description: • enable - (Optional) Specifies the configured parameters on the HA. Valid value: The value is true or false. The value true indicates creating HA DB instances. The value false indicates creating a single DB instance.

properties.name: replicationmode
properties.description: • replicationmode - (Optional) Specifies the replication mode for the standby DB instance. The value cannot be empty. For MySQL, the value is async or semisync. For PostgreSQL, the value is async or sync.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Required) Specifies the AZ name. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: db
properties.description: • db - (Required) Specifies the database information. Structure is documented below. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: flavor
properties.description: • flavor - (Required) Specifies the specification code.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the DB instance name. The DB instance name of the same type must be unique for the same tenant. The value must be 4 to 64 characters in length and start with a letter. It is case-sensitive and can contain only letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (_). Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Required) Specifies the security group which the RDS DB instance belongs to. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Specifies the subnet id. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: volume
properties.description: • volume - (Required) Specifies the volume information. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) Specifies the VPC ID. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: backup_strategy
properties.description: • backup_strategy - (Optional) Specifies the advanced backup policy. Structure is documented below.

properties.name: ha_replication_mode
properties.description: • ha_replication_mode - (Optional) Specifies the replication mode for the standby DB instance. For MySQL, the value is async or semisync. For PostgreSQL, the value is async or sync. For Microsoft SQL Server, the value is sync. NOTE: async indicates the asynchronous replication mode. semisync indicates the semi-synchronous replication mode. sync indicates the synchronous replication mode. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: param_group_id
properties.description: • param_group_id - (Optional) Specifies the parameter group ID. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: • tag - (Optional) Tags key/value pairs to associate with the instance.
The db block supports:

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required) Specifies the database password. The value cannot be empty and should contain 8 to 32 characters, including uppercase and lowercase letters, digits, and the following special characters: ~!@#%*-_=+? You are advised to enter a strong password to improve security, preventing security risks such as brute force cracking. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Optional) Specifies the database port information. The MySQL database port ranges from 1024 to 65535 (excluding 12017 and 33071, which are occupied by the RDS system and cannot be used). The PostgreSQL database port ranges from 2100 to 9500. The Microsoft SQL Server database port can be 1433 or ranges from 2100 to 9500, excluding 5355 and 5985. If this parameter is not set, the default value is as follows: For MySQL, the default value is 3306. For PostgreSQL, the default value is 5432. For Microsoft SQL Server, the default value is 1433. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Specifies the DB engine. Value: MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQLServer. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: user_name
properties.description: • user_name - Indicates the default user name of database.

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Required) Specifies the database version. MySQL databases support MySQL 5.6 and 5.7. PostgreSQL databases support PostgreSQL 9.5 and 9.6. Microsoft SQL Server databases support 2014 SE, 2016 SE, and 2016 EE. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The volume block supports:

properties.name: disk_encryption_id
properties.description: • disk_encryption_id - (Optional) Specifies the key ID for disk encryption. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) Specifies the volume size. Its value range is from 40 GB to 4000 GB. The value must be a multiple of 10. Changing this resize the volume.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
• type - (Required) Specifies the volume type. Its value can be any of the following and is case-sensitive: COMMON: indicates the SATA type.
    ULTRAHIGH: indicates the SSD type. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The backup_strategy block supports:

properties.name: keep_days
properties.description: • keep_days - (Optional) Specifies the retention days for specific backup files. The value range is from 0 to 732. If this parameter is not specified or set to 0, the automated backup policy is disabled. NOTICE: Primary/standby DB instances of Microsoft SQL Server do not support disabling the automated backup policy.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description:
• start_time - (Required) Specifies the backup time window. Automated backups will be triggered during the backup time window. It must be a valid value in the "hh:mm-HH:MM" format. The current time is in the UTC format. The HH value must be 1 greater than the hh value. The values of mm and MM must be the same and must be set to any of the following: 00, 15, 30, or

    1. Example value: 08:15-09:15 23:00-00:00.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The parameter group name. It contains a maximum of 64 characters.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The parameter group description. It contains a maximum of 256 characters and cannot contain the following special characters:>!<"&'= the value is left blank by default.

properties.name: values
properties.description: • values - (Optional) Parameter group values key/value pairs defined by users based on the default parameter groups.

properties.name: datastore
properties.description: • datastore - (Required) Database object. The database object structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new parameter group.
The datastore block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The DB engine. Currently, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and Microsoft SQL Server are supported. The value is case-insensitive and can be mysql, postgresql, or sqlserver.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: version - (Required) Specifies the database version.

properties.name: MySQL databases support MySQL 5.6 and 5.7. Example value: 5.7.
properties.description: • MySQL databases support MySQL 5.6 and 5.7. Example value: 5.7.

properties.name: PostgreSQL databases support PostgreSQL 9.5 and 9.6. Example value: 9.5.
properties.description: • PostgreSQL databases support PostgreSQL 9.5 and 9.6. Example value: 9.5.

properties.name: Microsoft SQL Server databases support 2014 SE, 2016 SE, and 2016 EE. Example value: 2014_SE.
properties.description: • Microsoft SQL Server databases support 2014 SE, 2016 SE, and 2016 EE. Example value: 2014_SE.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Indicates the name of an instance. An instance name starts with a letter, consists of 4 to 64 characters, and supports only letters, digits, and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Indicates the description of an instance. It is a character string containing not more than 1024 characters.

properties.name: engine
properties.description: • engine - (Required) Indicates a cache engine. Only Redis is supported. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: engine_version
properties.description: • engine_version - (Required) Indicates the version of a cache engine, which is 3.0.7. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: • capacity - (Required) Indicates the Cache capacity. Unit: GB. For a DCS Redis or Memcached instance in single-node or master/standby mode, the cache capacity can be 2 GB, 4 GB, 8 GB, 16 GB, 32 GB, or 64 GB. For a DCS Redis instance in cluster mode, the cache capacity can be 64, 128, 256, 512GB. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: access_user
properties.description: • access_user - (Optional) Username used for accessing a DCS instance after password authentication. A username starts with a letter, consists of 1 to 64 characters, and supports only letters, digits, and hyphens (-). Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required) Password of a DCS instance. The password of a DCS Redis instance must meet the following complexity requirements: Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) Tenant's VPC ID. For details on how to create VPCs, see the Virtual Private Cloud API Reference. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Required) Tenant's security group ID. For details on how to create security groups, see the Virtual Private Cloud API Reference.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Subnet ID. For details on how to create subnets, see the Virtual Private Cloud API Reference. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: available_zones
properties.description: • available_zones - (Required) IDs of the AZs where cache nodes reside. For details on how to query AZs, see Querying AZ Information. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: product_id
properties.description: • product_id - (Required) Product ID used to differentiate DCS instance types. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: maintain_begin
properties.description: • maintain_begin - (Optional) Indicates the time at which a maintenance time window starts. Format: HH:mm:ss. The start time and end time of a maintenance time window must indicate the time segment of a supported maintenance time window. For details, see section Querying Maintenance Time Windows. The start time must be set to 22:00, 02:00, 06:00, 10:00, 14:00, or 18:00. Parameters maintain_begin and maintain_end must be set in pairs. If parameter maintain_begin is left blank, parameter maintain_end is also blank. In this case, the system automatically allocates the default start time 02:00.

properties.name: maintain_end
properties.description: • maintain_end - (Optional) Indicates the time at which a maintenance time window ends. Format: HH:mm:ss. The start time and end time of a maintenance time window must indicate the time segment of a supported maintenance time window. For details, see section Querying Maintenance Time Windows. The end time is four hours later than the start time. For example, if the start time is 22:00, the end time is 02:00. Parameters maintain_begin and maintain_end must be set in pairs. If parameter maintain_end is left blank, parameter maintain_begin is also blank. In this case, the system automatically allocates the default end time 06:00.

properties.name: save_days
properties.description: • save_days - (Required) Retention time. Unit: day. Range: 1–7. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: backup_type
properties.description: • backup_type - (Required) Backup type. Options: auto: automatic backup. manual: manual backup. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: begin_at
properties.description: • begin_at - (Required) Time at which backup starts. "00:00-01:00" indicates that backup starts at 00:00:00. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: period_type
properties.description: • period_type - (Required) Interval at which backup is performed. Currently, only weekly backup is supported. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: backup_at
properties.description: • backup_at - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1 indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday. Changing this creates a new instance.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name (Required) - The name of the Dedicated Host.

properties.name: auto_placement
properties.description: • auto_placement (Optional) - Allows a instance to be automatically placed onto the available Dedicated Hosts. The default value is on.

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone (Required) - The Availability Zone to which the Dedicated Host belongs. Changing this parameter creates a new resource.

properties.name: host_type
properties.description: • host_type (Required) - The Dedicated Host type. Expected values are h1, general and d1. Changing this parameter creates a new resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Indicates the unique name of a queue. A string of 1 to 64 characters that contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, hyphens (-), and underscores (_). The name cannot be modified once specified.

properties.name: queue_mode
properties.description: • queue_mode - (Optional) Indicates the queue type. It only support 'NORMAL' and 'FIFO'. NORMAL: Standard queue. Best-effort ordering. Messages might be retrieved in an order different from which they were sent. Select standard queues when throughput is important. FIFO: First-ln-First-out (FIFO) queue. FIFO delivery. Messages are retrieved in the order they were sent. Select FIFO queues when the order of messages is important. Default value: NORMAL.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Indicates the basic information about a queue. The queue description must be 0 to 160 characters in length, and does not contain angle brackets (<) and (>).

properties.name: redrive_policy
properties.description: • redrive_policy - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable dead letter messages. Dead letter messages indicate messages that cannot be normally consumed. The redrive_policy should be set to 'enable' or 'disable'. The default value is 'disable'.

properties.name: max_consume_count
properties.description: • max_consume_count - (Optional) This parameter is mandatory only when redrive_policy is set to enable. This parameter indicates the maximum number of allowed message consumption failures. When a message fails to be consumed after the number of consumption attempts of this message reaches this value, DMS stores this message into the dead letter queue. The max_consume_count value range is 1–100.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Indicates the unique name of a group. A string of 1 to 64 characters that contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, hyphens (-), and underscores (_). The name cannot be modified once specified.

properties.name: queue_id
properties.description: • queue_id - (Required) Indicates the ID of a specified queue.

properties.name: zone_id

properties.name: email

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) The type of zone. Can either be public or private. Changing this creates a new zone.

properties.name: ttl

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the zone.

properties.description: • router_id (Required) The Router(VPC) ID. which VPC network will assicate with.

properties.name: router_region

properties.name: bandwidth
properties.description: • bandwidth - (Required) The bandwidth object.
